TextView.android:text: Ptah is the god of craftsmanship, metalworking, carpenters, shipbuilders, and sculpture. He is the husband of Sekhmet and the father of Nefertum. He is depicted as a green skinned man with a shroud stuck to his skin, with a divine beard, and holding a scepter combinding three powerful Egyptian symbols, the WAS, the ankh, and the djed. The WAS symbol is for power, the ankh symbol is life, and the djed symbol represents stability.
